channel.title: Trying to make webclient - same error with like 30 tuts?
channel.description: So, ive followed a few tuts, so has my friend. These are spanned over diff websites, diff tuts, diff people. It just refuses to work. I get the "An error occurred whilst loading RuneScape" crap, and ive tried 30 fixes that all fail. What am I doing wrong??? Its a delta 317 source.

item.title: Trying to make webclient - same error with like 30 tuts?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“VillainScape, post:9, topic:425739”]Its not. Its a plain old 317 (im pretty sure). It doesnt have the updated stuff.

EDIT: Could you give me and outline of what files the cache.zip should contain? Ive heard plenty of tries, like all my client files, to just the cache folder, to the animations and then the main_cache_1.ldx or things like that. What should it hold?[/quote]

well in general a client holds

-the compressed cache files (main_file_cache)
-models
-anims
-gfx
-sprites
-sounds(sometimes)

Read full topic
item.source: Trying to make webclient - same error with like 30 tuts?

item.title: Trying to make webclient - same error with like 30 tuts?

@VillainScape wrote:

Its not. Its a plain old 317 (im pretty sure). It doesnt have the updated stuff.

EDIT: Could you give me and outline of what files the cache.zip should contain? Ive heard plenty of tries, like all my client files, to just the cache folder, to the animations and then the main_cache_1.ldx or things like that. What should it hold?

Read full topic

item.title: Trying to make webclient - same error with like 30 tuts?

item.description:

Well I am assuming this is a 562+ revision client that has HD. Perhaps it has something to do with loading the graphics.

item.title: Trying to make webclient - same error with like 30 tuts?
item.dc:creator: @VillainScape VillainScape
item.description:
@VillainScape wrote:

Loveandpower:

All I can honestly say is…is that’s cache related. Perhaps it’s unpacking something before everything is unzipped?

I assumed so. But what could I be doing wrong?

Read full topic
